content.content: No longer updated. The latest Governance at a Glance posts will be posted one-per week in the #updates category.
content.GPT-summary: The post titled "Governance at a glance - Old" explains that the content is no longer updated and directs readers to find the latest posts in the #updates category. It does not explicitly ask for feedback or provide any proposal to be reviewed.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: I’m planning on updating this at least once a week going forward. Is this useful? What else would you like to see? Any feedback is welcome. I’d like to have a section headed Ongoing Initiatives which calls attention to the governance or risk related projects that are actively being worked on. If you are working on something governance/risk related and have a moment to spare, write up a summary post of what you are doing, and I’ll link to it here. This goes equally for the Foundation, can we get a very brief post describing each governance/risk related thing that is currently happening (as much as can be shared?) The planned governance dashboard comes to mind as one example.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is asking for feedback
Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: Love this idea, maybe once it becomes a habit we can call it out in the Governance call and in the socials.     LongForWisdom:  This goes equally for the Foundation, can we get a very brief post describing each governance/risk related thing that is currently happening (as much as can be shared?) The planned governance dashboard comes to mind as one example.   There is a Community and Governance portal being worked on right now that houses ‘canonical’ docs and information about ongoing initiatives. It might be expanded to include Risk as well. I’m thinking about setting up some subcategories in the Community section for projects that require comment and another for ‘bounties’. The Governance Dashboard is a good example, it’s been difficult to find a team willing to take the on the project. Later: As an experiment, I’ve just created a help-wanted tag and posted a RFP for a Governance Dashboard.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party asking questions about proposal
3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party extending to proposal

content.content: It’s set up to pin topics that are unread by default. Once a user scrolls to the bottom of the thread it becomes unpinned. Someone would have to test the implications of changing the setting site wide. Users can also change it in their own settings in Interface -> Other:  [x] Automatically unpin topics when I reach the bottom. EDIT: I just pinned this topic in the Governance category.
GPT-discussion-categories: None

content.content: Bumped for this week. I’ll be honest, it’s been a slow one…

Links reflect my view of the most noteworthy activity in the governance, risk and oracles categories right now. Disagree? Think something should be added? Leave a reply or a pm. content.content: Updated for the new week. Still a bunch of signal requests either in progress or moving on-chain. Seriously impressed by the level of participation and the desire to get things done over the past weeks. That said, I would encourage potential signal authors to prioritise and consider governance bandwidth when creating signals. Ask yourself whether the signal is necessary now as opposed to later, take a look at how many other signals have been created and try to figure out an optimal time to post.
